plot: Larry has made a large donation to a nonprofit and they name a wing after him. But he's indignant to discover Ted Danson made a similar donation, staying "anonymous." Also, Cheryl is livid when she finds a large stain in the guest bedroom.

Larry decides to be nice for a change and actually donate money to a worthy cause. But when Ted Danson overshadows Larry by donating to the same hospital "anonymously," Larry goes ballistic. He then accuses a dry cleaner of giving his jersey to someone else and goes off in search of it. Meanwhile, Larry, Jeff, Ted, and the Blacks get their reputation stained.—halo1k

Larry and Cheryl move into their new home and welcome an additional house guest - Loretta Black's brother Leon - who Larry immediately accuses of an unspeakable act. In other news, Larry gripes over the questionable anonymity of a donation, and considers rewriting the laws of dry-cleaning.—JPK
